overview:
Cor Winkler Prins is VP Product Management at the ITRP Institute.

In 1996 Cor joined PROLIN, which was later aquired by HP, to help get its ITSM consulting department off the ground in the U.S. He mainly focused on assisting large corporations like Philip Morris, Roche, DHL and Avaya with their global ITSM deployments.

Cor specializes in translating ITIL theory into practical process definitions and ITSM tool specifications. His work had a major impact on the ITSM industry when in 1999 he developed the first comprehensive set of integrated ITIL-based ITSM processes, called the Alignability Process Model. It includes detailed work instructions for IT professionals. Alignability was later acquired by BMC Software. This set of process definitions and implementation practices is used by ITSM consultants in more than 20 countries.

His main interest has always been the financial management of IT services to help managers balance the level of service with the service costs.
